definition[0]: a market or area where there are a lot of small shops, especially in India or the Middle East
definition[1]: an occasion when a lot of people sell different things to collect money for a good purpose
definition[2]: a market, especially in India, North Africa, or the Middle East
example[1]: a bustling local market and bazaar
definition[3]: a place where things are bought and sold in a disorganized or unofficial way
example[2]: The free market’s arrival turned Poland’s cities into cut-price bazaars.
